Legal_Issue: Whether Apotex must disclose portions of its drug submission process for paroxetine hydrochloride to assess non-infringement claims
Governing_Law: Section 6(7) of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Evidence_Assessment: SmithKline provided expert evidence; Apotex argued process details were irrelevant
Burden_of_Proof: On Apotex to demonstrate that disclosure is unnecessary or irrelevant
Legal_Rule: Courts may order production of relevant portions of a drug submission and verification by the Minister under Section 6(7)
Standard_of_Review: Relevance and necessity of disclosed information for assessing infringement
Procedural_Issue: Motion for disclosure and verification orders
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged patent infringement and inadequate disclosure under regulatory requirements
Review_Standard: Assessment of relevance and compliance with regulatory obligations
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Balancing need for transparency with proprietary concerns in drug submissions
Key_Evidence_Considered: Expert evidence on manufacturing process, submission documents
Applicant_Challenge: SmithKline challenged adequacy of Apotex's disclosure
Court_Result: Apotex must produce relevant portions of its submission; Minister must verify correspondence with filed information
Legal_Rule_Source: Section 6(7) of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Defendant_Response: Apotex contended that process details were irrelevant to the infringement analysis
Outcome: Motion granted; disclosure and verification required
Remedy_Sought: Order for production and ministerial verification
Legal_Provision: Section 6(7) of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 6(7) of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Insufficient disclosure by Apotex regarding drug submission process
Applicable_Process: Regulatory and judicial process under NOC Regulations
Governing_Rule: Section 6(7) of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
